name: archipilot
description: TOGAF-aligned Enterprise Architecture assistant that uses Obsidian vaults as structured context, powered by GitHub Copilot.

viewsWelcome.contents:

chatParticipants.name: architect
chatParticipants.description: Enterprise Architecture Copilot – TOGAF-aligned assistant for Obsidian architecture vaults

commands.name: analyze
commands.description: Analyze architecture impact without modifying files

commands.name: status
commands.description: Show vault overview and decision status

commands.name: c4
commands.description: Generate a C4 model diagram (Context, Container, Component, Code)

commands.name: sizing
commands.description: Create or update a sizing catalogue (infrastructure, capacity, cost)

commands.name: timeline
commands.description: Generate a delivery timeline / Gantt from the roadmap

commands.name: new
commands.description: Create a new empty architecture vault / project

commands.name: archimate
commands.description: Export vault to ArchiMate Open Exchange Format 3.2 (XML)

commands.name: drawio
commands.description: Export vault to Draw.io diagrams (As-Is, Target, Migration with color-coded changes)

commands.name: todo
commands.description: List next TOGAF action items: open decisions, risks, questions, work packages, and more

commands.name: adr
commands.description: Record a new Architecture Decision — e.g. /adr Use PostgreSQL for transactional data

commands.name: diagram
commands.description: Generate a Mermaid context diagram from the active file's [[WikiLinks]]

commands.name: graph
commands.description: Visualize the entire vault as a full dependency graph (Mermaid flowchart)

commands.name: impact
commands.description: Show the cross-vault impact chain for a TOGAF ID, e.g. /impact AD-02 or /impact R-05

commands.name: review
commands.description: Automated architecture review — assess quality, completeness, and TOGAF compliance

commands.name: gate
commands.description: Phase gate checklist — evaluate whether a TOGAF ADM phase is ready to proceed

commands.title: archipilot: Export Vault to Draw.io (As-Is / Target / Migration)

archipilot.vaultPath.description: Path to the active Obsidian architecture vault folder. Leave empty to auto-detect from workspace.

archipilot.projectsRoot.description: Folder name (relative to workspace root) where architecture projects are created and discovered. The /new command creates vaults inside this folder.

archipilot.hiddenQuickActions.description: List of Quick Action labels or command shortcuts to hide from the sidebar (e.g. ["Sizing Catalogue", "/sizing"]). Use the label text or the /command shortcut shown in the Quick Actions panel.

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with archipilot
walkthroughs.description: Set up your TOGAF-aligned architecture vault and start working with your Enterprise Architecture Copilot.

steps.title: Create an Architecture Vault
steps.description:
Open Copilot Chat and type **@architect /new MyProject** to scaffold a TOGAF-aligned vault with 27 template files.

[Create a vault](command:archipilot.newVault)

steps.title: Check Vault Status
steps.description:
Type **@architect /status** in Copilot Chat to see your vault overview — file counts, decision statuses, and open questions.

[Show status](command:archipilot.showStatus)

steps.title: Analyze Architecture Impact
steps.description: Ask **@architect /analyze** a question like *"What is the impact of migrating to microservices?"* to get a grounded analysis from your vault.

steps.title: Update Your Vault
steps.description: Use **@architect /update** to add decisions, update sections, or modify metadata. archipilot shows a diff preview before applying changes.
